item.title: ‘PM Modi, Kejriwal failed to reduce inflation': Rahul Gandhi at Delhi rally - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘PM Modi, Kejriwal failed to reduce inflation': Rahul Gandhi at Delhi rally

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rahul Gandhi, Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, accused PM Narendra Modi and AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal of failing to address rising inflation during a rally in Delhi.

  • Gandhi stated that inflation is at its peak, adversely affecting the poor.
  • He criticized Modi's relationship with industrialists Ambani and Adani, calling for a more equitable society.
  • Gandhi emphasized the need to protect the Constitution from perceived threats posed by the BJP and RSS.
  • Both the Congress and AAP are contesting upcoming Delhi elections separately.
  • The Delhi assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, with counting on February 8.
“Inflation is at its peak. Poor people are becoming poorer and rich people are becoming richer.”

In conclusion, Gandhi’s remarks highlight significant discontent with current leadership's economic policies as both parties prepare for a competitive electoral battle.

item.title: Swami Vivekananda’s visit to Belagavi recalled - The Hindu
item.description:

item.title: J&K ACB registers Disproportionate Assets case against retired Superintending Engineer - Cross Town News
item.description:
J&K ACB registers Disproportionate Assets case against retired Superintending Engineer

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Jammu and Kashmir Anti Corruption Bureau

The Jammu and Kashmir Anti Corruption Bureau has launched an investigation into retired Superintending Engineer Riyaz Ahmad Parray for allegedly amassing assets beyond his known income through corrupt practices.

  • The Anti Corruption Bureau verified allegations against Parray, revealing disproportionate assets.
  • Properties acquired include multiple flats, houses, and land in Jammu, Delhi, and Baramulla.
  • An FIR No. 01/2025 under the Prevention of Corruption Act has been registered against him.
  • Searches were conducted at various locations, yielding incriminating documents.
“The expenditures incurred and the value of assets acquired by the accused during service period have been found prima facie disproportionate to his known sources of income.”

Further investigations are ongoing as the Anti Corruption Bureau continues to explore the extent of the alleged corruption.

item.description:

Published on: January 2023, Source: Indian Express

In a significant statement during a BJP state executive meeting, Union Home Minister Amit Shah condemned Uddhav Thackeray’s Shiv Sena (UBT) and Sharad Pawar’s NCP (SP), reinforcing the legitimacy of rival factions within Maharashtra’s political landscape.

item.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw fact-checks Mark Zuckerberg over India polls remark: 'Misinformation' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ashwini Vaishnaw fact-checks Mark Zuckerberg over India polls remark: 'Misinformation'

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw criticized Mark Zuckerberg's remark that India's ruling party lost major elections, stressing the importance of factual accuracy during discussions.

  • Vaishnaw refuted Zuckerberg's claim about India's elections, highlighting the victory of the BJP in the 2024 general elections.
  • Zuckerberg suggested a global trend of incumbent losses due to various factors, including economic policies and pandemic responses.
  • Vaishnaw stated that over 640 million voters reaffirmed their trust in PM Narendra Modi's leadership.
  • He called for maintaining facts and credibility in discussions, especially from influential figures like Zuckerberg.
"Let’s uphold facts and credibility," Vaishnaw stressed.

The exchange emphasizes the impact of misinformation in the digital age, particularly from high-profile individuals.

item.title: On India-China border situation, Army chief rules out ‘buffer zones’ along LAC - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Army Chief Discusses India-China Border Stability and Disengagement

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi stated that the border situation with China is stable but sensitive, denying the existence of buffer zones along the Line of Actual Control (LAC).

  • Both Indian and Chinese armies completed disengagement at Depsang and Demchok in eastern Ladakh last October.
  • General Dwivedi emphasized the need for a broader understanding to rebuild trust.
  • Verification patrolling has been successfully conducted by both sides.
"It is stable but sensitive... overall, both sides will remain back and will not go to the common areas because we still feel that if we meet at those places, the violence level may go high." - General Upendra Dwivedi

This ongoing dialogue and military disengagement are crucial for maintaining peace along the contentious border.

item.title: AIBE 19 Result Expected To Be Declared Soon, Where And How To Check? - News18
item.description:
AIBE 19 Result Expected To Be Declared Soon, Where And How To Check?

Last Updated: January 13, 2025, 19:24 IST

The Bar Council of India (BCI) is expected to release the All India Bar Examination (AIBE) 19 result soon. Candidates who took the exam can check the result on the official website at allindiabarexamination.com, using their registration ID and password.

AIBE 19 Result: Key Points

  • The BCI will release the scorecards based on the answer key objections.
  • Results can be checked on the official website.
  • Correct answers are awarded one mark, with no negative marking.
  • Passing marks for general candidates range from 40% to 45%.
  • The pass rate for SC, ST, and PWD candidates has been raised to 40% from 35%.

AIBE 19 Result: Steps to Check

  1. Visit the official BCI website.
  2. Navigate to the ‘Results’ section.
  3. Click on the AIBE 19 Result link.
  4. Enter your login credentials.
  5. Submit and review your result.
  6. Download and print your result for future reference.

Notable Quote

“There is no need to worry about any mismatch between the QP booklet number and OMR answer sheet serial number,” the BCI has informed.

In conclusion, candidates should stay tuned for the results and be prepared to check them as soon as they are released.

item.title: Indian fighting for Russia killed in Ukraine war, deceased hailed from Kerala: Report - Firstpost
item.description:
Indian from Kerala Dies Fighting for Russia in Ukraine War

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

A man from Kerala named Binil TB has died while fighting for the Russian military in Ukraine. This report highlights the recruitment of Indian nationals to the ongoing conflict, often through fraudulent means.

  • Binil TB was 32 years old and hailed from Thrissur, Kerala.
  • His relative, Jain TK, was injured in the same incident.
  • Officials from the Indian embassy in Moscow verbally confirmed his death.
  • Binil's family reported that he died in a drone attack.
  • Indians recruited for military roles often find themselves on the frontlines despite being promised non-combatant jobs.
  • Ajith Kolassery from NORKA ROOTS mentioned there is a lack of formal information on the incident from the Ministry of External Affairs.
“Mentally and physically, we are exhausted. We have been pleading with local commanders for our release.” - Binil TB

This incident raises concerns over the plight of foreign fighters in Ukraine and the deceptive recruitment practices used by the Russian military.

item.title: Budget 2025: Revised Income Tax Slabs, Higher Standard Deduction, Section 80C Limit Increase – Know Key Exp - News18
item.description:
Budget 2025: Revised Income Tax Slabs, Higher Standard Deduction, Section 80C Limit Increase – Know Key Expectations

Date: January 13, 2025, Source: News18

As Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepares for the Budget 2025 announcements, significant changes to income tax are anticipated, primarily aimed at benefiting salaried individuals.

  • Increase in Standard Deduction: The standard deduction may increase from ₹50,000 to a maximum cap of ₹1 lakh.
  • Revised Income Tax Slabs: Speculation about changing the 30% tax rate to apply for income above ₹20 lakh for a fairer tax structure.
  • Senior Citizens’ Tax Reforms: Possible increases in exemption limits for taxpayers aged 60 and above.
  • Raising Section 80C Deduction Limit: Experts suggest increasing the deduction limit under Section 80C from ₹1.5 lakh to ₹3.5 lakh.
  • Possible Import Duty Hike on Gold: An increase in import duty on gold may be considered to address trade deficits.
“Budget 2025 aims to provide significant income tax relief for salaried individuals.”

Overall, these proposed changes could significantly impact taxpayers, potentially easing their financial burden as the cost of living continues to rise.

item.title: India summons Bangla deputy envoy after Dhaka’s objection on border fencing - The Tribune India
item.description:
India Summons Bangladeshi Diplomat Over Border Fencing Dispute

Publication Date: Monday

Source: The Tribune

India has summoned Bangladesh’s Deputy High Commissioner, Nural Islam, following objections raised by Dhaka regarding India’s border fencing project, which Bangladesh claims is unauthorized and disruptive to cooperative relations.

  • The Ministry of External Affairs summoned the Bangladeshi envoy after Dhaka's strong objections.
  • Bangladesh Ministry of Foreign Affairs expressed concern over India's actions, referring to them as provocative.
  • The border fencing aims to prevent illegal migration; however, disputes have escalated tensions.
  • India’s envoy emphasized the commitment to a crime-free border through cooperation.
  • Discussions between Indian and Bangladeshi border forces are scheduled for next month.
  • Recent incidents, including the reported killing of a Bangladeshi citizen by the BSF, have heightened concerns.
“We have an understanding with regard to fencing the border for security.” - Indian envoy Pranay Verma

The situation reflects ongoing tensions between India and Bangladesh, highlighting the need for dialogue and resolution of border issues.

item.title: ‘When will you add Delhi’s Jats to Centre’s OBC list?': Arvind Kejriwal asks PM Modi, Amit Shah - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Presses for Delhi Jats' Inclusion in OBC List

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) convenor Arvind Kejriwal has once again called for the inclusion of Delhi's Jat community in the Centre's Other Backward Classes (OBC) list, after meeting with a delegation of Jat leaders who expressed grievances over unfulfilled promises from the government.

  • Kejriwal met with Jat leaders and highlighted their voting power in Delhi.
  • He emphasized that while Jats in Rajasthan benefit from OBC status, Delhi's Jats do not receive similar privileges.
  • Kejriwal questioned Prime Minister Modi and Home Minister Shah regarding the delay in including Delhi's Jats in the OBC list.
  • The BJP criticized Kejriwal's call as an election gimmick and claimed he had not previously raised the issue.
“The top two leaders of the country -- Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah -- had promised the Jat community of Delhi that they will be given OBC reservation at the central level but the promise remains unfulfilled.” - Arvind Kejriwal

This development highlights ongoing tensions between the AAP and the BJP regarding promises made to the Jat community and the political implications as elections approach.

item.title: Meet the women Naga Sadhus at Maha Kumbh - Firstpost
item.description:
Meet the women Naga Sadhus at Maha Kumbh

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: News18

The Maha Kumbh Mela, held in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, has seen millions of devotees gathering for purification through holy dips. While much attention is on male Naga Sadhus, the female Naga Sadhus, or Sadhvis, are increasingly recognized for their spiritual significance.

  • Millions attend the Maha Kumbh Mela, the largest religious gathering worldwide.
  • Female Naga Sadhus dedicate themselves to a life of asceticism, similar to their male counterparts.
  • They sever ties with familial attachments to pursue spiritual enlightenment.
  • The initiation for female Naga Sadhus is rigorous, requiring intense commitment and training.
  • Despite differences in dress, female Naga Sadhus hold a revered position in the community.
  • Naga Sadhus perform first bathing rights during the Kumbh Mela, symbolizing their spiritual leadership.
“The Battle of Gyan Vapi was fought in 1664 by the Naga ascetic warriors of the Mahanirvani Akhara...” - James G. Lochtefeld

The presence of female Naga Sadhus at such a significant event underscores their role in spiritual traditions and their contribution to the cultural fabric of Indian society.
